actions.recommendation: A 24-hour ambulatory blood pressure monitoring (ABPM) is required.
Routine male screening includes review of the prostate gland. Your recent PSA levels (a prostate marker) on your blood work were normal.
Have a prostate ultrasound as part of routine preventative screening when you hit 50yrs of age.

Your general exam did not pick up any red flags. Your systems exam was unremarkable and you appear in general good health. You had one high BP reading. With BP being dynamic and this a snapshot, we need more data - please see note under Vitals.
I suggest that you have a prostate ultrasound as part of routine preventative screening when you hit 50yrs of age. Your PSA was in range and you have no other red flags.
Youâ€™ve been able to maintain a good weight with regular exercise & a healthy diet. This will reduce your risk for future illness (such as hypertension). Keep going with these lifestyle habits.
We identified a few areas that can be optimised and have started treatment for your high cholesterol. This we can follow-up in the new year.
